tit.e: Tegotomono (a form of Japanese chamber music)
Tegotomono (a form of Japanese chamber music)
Tegotomono (a form of Japanese chamber music)

sen.j: 手事物(てごともの) は、三曲の音楽である地歌、箏曲、胡弓楽において、器楽部である手事を備えた楽曲形式 (この場合『手事物形式』とも呼ぶ)、また曲種のこと。
sen.e: Tegotomono is the style of composition which has the instrumental parts (here, it is also called "tegotomono-form") or the kind of song in sankyoku music which consists of jiuta, so (or koto) music and kokyu (Chinese fiddle) music.

Tegotomono is the style of composition which has instrumental parts (here, it is also called "tegotomono-form") or the kind of songs in sankyoku music which consists of jiuta, so (or koto) music and kokyu (Chinese fiddle) music.

Tegotomono is the style of composition which has instrumental parts (here, it is also called "tegotomono-form") or the kind of songs in sankyoku music which consists of jiuta, so (or koto) music and kokyu (Chinese fiddle) music.

sen.j: 概説
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 現在演奏される地歌曲の中で、もっともよく取り上げられるのが手事物である。
sen.e: Among the jiuta music which is played now, tegotomono is most often played.
Among the jiuta music which is played now, tegotomono is most often played.
Among the jiuta music which is played now, tegotomono is most often played.

sen.j: また箏曲でも、古典曲の場合過半数が手事物である。
sen.e: Also in so (or koto) music, most of them are tegotomono in the case of classic music.
Also in so (or koto) music, most of them are tegotomono in the case of classic music.
Also in so (or koto) music, most of them are tegotomono in the case of classic music.

sen.j: 胡弓楽では、普通手事物とは言わないが、実質的に本曲のすべてが手事物と言ってよい。
sen.e: Normally in kokyu music, they are not called tegotomoto, but virtually all the original works are said to be tegotomono.
Normally in kokyu music, they are not called tegotomoto, but virtually all the original works are said to be tegotomono.
Normally in kokyu music, they are not called tegotomoto, but virtually all the original works are said to be tegotomono.

sen.j: 楽式構造
sen.e: Music form structure
Music form structure
Music form structure

sen.j: 基本的な楽式構造は、前唄 - 手事 - 後唄という三段構成をとるが、大曲になると前唄 - 手事 - 中唄 - 手事 - 後唄という構成のものも多い。
sen.e: The basic music form structure has the three-step structure which consists of maeuta (the former song), tegoto (Japanese Koto) and atouta (the latter song), but in large scale songs, many have the structure which consists of maeuta, tegoto, nakauta (the middle song), tegoto and atouta.

The basic music form structure has the three-step structure which consists of maeuta (the former song), tegoto (Japanese Koto) and atouta (the latter song), but in large scale songs, many have a structure which consists of maeuta, tegoto, nakauta (the middle song), tegoto and atouta.

The basic music form structure has the three-step structure which consists of maeuta (the former song), tegoto (Japanese Koto) and atouta (the latter song), but in large scale songs, many have a structure which consists of maeuta, tegoto, nakauta (the middle song), tegoto and atouta.

sen.j: 更に歌と手事がもう一回ずつ加わった曲もある。
sen.e: Moreover, uta (song) and tegoto are respectively once more added to some songs.
Moreover, uta (song) and tegoto are respectively once more added to some songs.
Moreover, uta (song) and tegoto are respectively once more added to some songs.

sen.j: また前弾き (前奏部) を伴う曲もある。
sen.e: And some have a prelude part.
And some have a prelude part.
And some have a prelude part.

sen.j: 前唄は通常緩徐部分と早い部分に分けられるものがほとんどで、その間に短い間奏部である「合の手」を最低一回挟む。
sen.e: Most of maeuta are usually divided into the slow parts and the fast parts and a short intermezzo "ai no te" is inserted between them at least once.
Most maeuta are usually divided into the slow parts and the fast parts and a short intermezzo "ai no te" is inserted between them at least once.
Most maeuta are usually divided into the slow parts and the fast parts and a short intermezzo 'ai no te' is inserted between them at least once.

sen.j: この合の手がかなり長い場合もある。
sen.e: This intermezzo is sometimes very long.
This intermezzo is sometimes very long.
This intermezzo is sometimes very long.

sen.j: 大曲、あるいは前唄の長い曲では、合の手が数カ所に配される。
sen.e: The large-scale song or the song which has a long maeuta have several intermezzos.
Large-scale songs or songs which has a long maeuta have several intermezzos.
Large-scale songs or songs which has a long maeuta have several intermezzos.

sen.j: 前唄の最初、あるいは前唄緩徐部分の終わりに、短い歌のみの独唱部を持つものもある。
sen.e: At the first part of maeuta or the last part of slow part of maeuta, some have a solo which consists of only a short song.
In the first part of the maeuta or the last part of the slow part of a maeuta, some have a solo which consists of only a short song.
In the first part of the maeuta or the last part of the slow part of a maeuta, some have a solo which consists of only a short song.

sen.j: 手事はいくつかの「段」に分かれていることが多く、それぞれ拍数が等しく変奏曲のようになっているものがある。
sen.e: Many tegotos are divided into several "dan," and each dan has the same beat rate and some are like variations.
Many tegotos are divided into several "dan," and each dan has the same beat rate and some are like variations.
Many tegotos are divided into several 'dan,' and each dan has the same beat rate and some are like variations.

sen.j: これらの段は互いに合奏できるようになっている (段合わせ)。
sen.e: These dans can be mutually played in an ensemble (danawase, type of ensemble method).
These dans can be mutually played in an ensemble (danawase, type of ensemble method).
These dans can be mutually played in an ensemble (danawase, type of ensemble method).

sen.j: 更にたいてい手事の最後にコーダ (音楽)的な「チラシ」がつく。
sen.e: Furthermore, mostly musical "chirashi" (coda) is inserted at the last of tegoto.
Furthermore, mostly musical "chirashi" (coda) is inserted in the end of tegoto.
Furthermore, mostly musical 'chirashi' (coda) is inserted in the end of tegoto.

sen.j: 「チラシ」とは手事の気分を散らすことから来ていると言われる。
sen.e: "Chirashi" is said to have originated from the distraction from tegoto.
"Chirashi" is said to have originated from the distraction from tegoto.
Chirashi' is said to have originated from the distraction from tegoto.

sen.j: 曲によってはチラシが更に二つまたは三つに分かれているものもある (中チラシ、後チラシ、本チラシなど)。
sen.e: Some songs have the chirashi which are divided into two or three further (naka-chirashi (the middle coda), ato-chirashi (the latter coda), hon-chirashi (the main coda) and so on).
Some songs have chirashi which are further divided into two or three parts (naka-chirashi (the middle coda), ato-chirashi (the latter coda), hon-chirashi (the main coda) and so on).
Some songs have chirashi which are further divided into two or three parts (naka-chirashi (the middle coda), ato-chirashi (the latter coda), hon-chirashi (the main coda) and so on).

sen.j: また京流手事物では手事の冒頭に導入部として「序」あるいは「マクラ」という部分のある曲も多い。
sen.e: Also in Kyoto-style tegotomono, many have a part of "jo" or "makura" (prelude) as an introduction of tegoto.
Also in Kyoto-style tegotomono, many have a part of "jo" or "makura" (prelude) as an introduction of tegoto.
Also in Kyoto-style tegotomono, many have a part of 'jo' or 'makura' (prelude) as an introduction of tegoto.

sen.j: 後唄はたいてい前唄よりも短く、合の手も少なく、あっても短いが、曲全体のコーダ的、あるいは序破急の急的役割をしている。
sen.e: Mostly atouta is shorter than maeuta, the ai-no-te is fewer if any they are short and plays a role of coda of the whole song or a "kyu" of "Jo-ha-kyu" (three segments of performance and speed of plays; slower and quieter performance during the jo (beginning), gradually gaining the tempo in the ha (middle portion), and becoming more energetic during the kyu (denouement)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Mostly atouta is shorter than maeuta, the ai-no-te is fewer if any, and they are short and play a role of coda of the whole song or a "kyu" of "Jo-ha-kyu" (three segments of performance and speed of plays; slower and quieter performance during the jo (beginning), gradually gaining the tempo in the ha (middle portion), and becoming more energetic during the kyu (denouement)).

Mostly atouta is shorter than maeuta, the ai-no-te is fewer if any, and they are short and play a role of coda of the whole song or a "kyu" of "Jo-ha-kyu" (three segments of performance and speed of plays; slower and quieter performance during the jo (beginning), gradually gaining the tempo in the ha (middle portion), and becoming more energetic during the kyu (denouement)).

sen.j: 手事がリタルダントして終わった後、それを受けてゆっくり始まるがすぐに早くなり、最後の盛り上がりを形作る。
sen.e: After tegoto becomes gradually slower and finishes, atouta, taking over this, gradually begins but soon becomes faster and forms the last climax.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After tegoto becomes gradually slower and finishes, atouta, taking over this, gradually begins but soon becomes faster and forms the last climax.
After tegoto becomes gradually slower and finishes, atouta, taking over this, gradually begins but soon becomes faster and forms the last climax.

sen.j: ここで転調が行なわれ気分の高揚に役立たせているものも多く、更に転調を繰り返して一段と気分を高めている曲もある。
sen.e: Here many works use modulation to lift the feeling and some repeat modulation to lift the feeling more and more.
Here many works use modulation to lift the feeling and some repeat modulation to lift the feeling more and more.
Here many works use modulation to lift the feeling and some repeat modulation to lift the feeling more and more.

sen.j: 胡弓本曲では前唄と手事のみの構成も多い。
sen.e: Many original kokyu music works structurally consist only of maeuta and tegoto.
Many original kokyu music works structurally consist only of maeuta and tegoto.
Many original kokyu music works structurally consist only of maeuta and tegoto.

sen.j: 一つの曲において歌や手事は段落として切れ目はあるが、雅楽の序、破、急や、西洋音楽の楽章のように、いったん完全に終止し時間を置いてからまた始めるのではなく、連続して演奏される。
sen.e: The song and tegoto in one song have hiatuses as paragraphs, but unlike Jo-ha-kyu in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) or movements in Western music, sound does not stop completely and begin after a while, but the performance seamlessly continues.

The song and tegoto in one song have hiatuses as paragraphs, but unlike Jo-ha-kyu in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) or movements in Western music, sound does not stop completely and begins after a while, but the performance seamlessly continues.

The song and tegoto in one song have hiatuses as paragraphs, but unlike Jo-ha-kyu in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) or movements in Western music, sound does not stop completely and begins after a while, but the performance seamlessly continues.

sen.j: 歌と手事の間で大きな転調があり調弦が変わることも少なくない。
sen.e: There is a large modulation between the song and tegoto and the tuning often changes.
There is a large modulation between the song and tegoto and the tuning often changes.
There is a large modulation between the song and tegoto and the tuning often changes.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 曲の中間にまとまった器楽部分をもつ地歌曲は、すでに地歌最古の種目である「組歌」の「乱後夜」「晴嵐」にも見られる。
sen.e: Jiuta songs which have a cohesive instrumental part at the middle of the songs were seen in "Rangoya" and "Seiran" which were "kumiuta" (koto suites of songs) that were the oldest kind of jiuta.
Jiuta songs which have a cohesive instrumental part at the middle of the songs were seen in "Rangoya" and "Seiran" which were "kumiuta" (koto suites of songs) that were the oldest kind of jiuta.
Jiuta songs which have a cohesive instrumental part at the middle of the songs were seen in 'Rangoya' and 'Seiran' which were 'kumiuta' (koto suites of songs) that were the oldest kind of jiuta.

sen.j: 手事物そのものは、元禄の頃に発生したと考えられ、深草検校の『さらし』、岸野二郎三の『六段恋慕』、佐山検校の『三段獅子』などがもっとも初期の作品として知られる。
sen.e: Tegotomono itself is thought to have emerged around Genroku era and "Sarashi" by kengyo FUKAKUSA, "Rokudan Renbo" by Jirosan KISHINO, "San Dan Jishi" (triple lion) by kengyo SAYAMA and so on are known as the works of the early period.
sen.cmt: 「岸野二郎三」を「きしのじろうさん」と読みました。
sen.e: Tegotomono itself is thought to have emerged around the Genroku era and "Sarashi" by kengyo FUKAKUSA, "Rokudan Renbo" by Jirosan KISHINO, "San Dan Jishi" (triple lion) by kengyo SAYAMA and so on are known as the works of the early period.

Tegotomono itself is thought to have emerged around the Genroku era and "Sarashi" by kengyo FUKAKUSA, "Rokudan Renbo" by Jirosan KISHINO, "San Dan Jishi" (triple lion) by kengyo SAYAMA and so on are known as the works of the early period.

sen.j: しかし当時はまだ「手事物」というジャンル分けはなく、これらは「長歌」に含まれていた。
sen.e: However in those days, the genre "tegotomono" was not yet established and included in "choka" (long epic song).
However in those days, the genre "tegotomono" was not yet established and included in "choka" (long epic song).
However in those days, the genre 'tegotomono' was not yet established and included in 'choka' (long epic song).

sen.j: 実際、手事物は地歌において組歌や長歌から派生 (短い合の手が発展) したものと、もともと器楽曲であったものに歌の部分を付加したものの二通りがあると考えられる。
sen.e: In fact, tegotomono is thought to be divided into two kinds: the one which originated from kumiuta or choka in jiuta (short intermezzo developed) and the one which added the song parts to the works that were originally piece of instrumental music.

In fact, tegotomono is thought to be divided into two kinds: the one which originated from kumiuta or choka in jiuta (short intermezzo developed) and the one which added the song parts to the works that were originally pieces of instrumental music.

sen.j: 後者の代表曲としては『八千代獅子』が挙げられる。
sen.e: The representative song of the latter includes "Yachiyojishi."
The representative song of the latter includes "Yachiyojishi."
The representative song of the latter includes "Yachiyojishi."

sen.j: 江戸時代中期の地歌は長歌物、そして端歌物が中心で、ことに端歌は大阪の藤永検校、鶴山勾当、政島検校をはじめとする作曲家たちにより、厖大な数の曲が作られ、端歌物全盛時代であった。
sen.e: Jiuta during the middle of Edo period was mainly choka or hauta (short song) and especially enormous numbers of hauta were composed by kengyo FUJINAGA, koto (the title of the official ranks within the Todo-za (the traditional guild for the blind)) TSURUYAMA, kengyo MASASHIMA and so on and hauta was at its zenith.

Jiuta during the middle of the Edo period was mainly choka or hauta (short song) and especially enormous numbers of hauta were composed by kengyo FUJINAGA, koto (the title of the official ranks within the Todo-za (the traditional guild for the blind)) TSURUYAMA, kengyo MASASHIMA and so on and hauta was at its zenith.

Jiuta during the middle of the Edo period was mainly choka or hauta (short song) and especially enormous numbers of hauta were composed by kengyo FUJINAGA, koto (the title of the official ranks within the Todo-za (the traditional guild for the blind)) TSURUYAMA, kengyo MASASHIMA and so on and hauta was at its zenith.

sen.j: 手事物という分類項目が使われたのは寛政元年 (1789年) に出版された「古今集成琴曲新歌袋」であるとされる。
sen.e: Tegotomono is said to have been firstly established as the classifying genre in "Shin utabukuro" (the New Collection of Koto Music in History) published in 1789.
sen.cmt: 「古今集成琴曲新歌袋」の英訳は、サンフレアの単語集では"Shin utabukuro" (the New Collection of Koto Music in History)となっており、それに従いました。
sen.e: Tegotomono is said to have been firstly established as a classifying genre in "Shin utabukuro" (the New Collection of Koto Music in History) published in 1789.
Tegotomono is said to have been firstly established as a classifying genre in 'Shin utabukuro' (the New Collection of Koto Music in History) published in 1789.

sen.j: この頃になると手事物の曲も増え、大阪の峰崎勾当や三ツ橋勾当によって手事物はより整備され、歌よりも手事に作曲の比重を置いた曲が多くなる。
sen.e: Around that time the works of tegotomono increased, tegotomono was streamlined further by koyo MINEZAKI or koto MITSUHASHI and the works which emphasized tegoto rather than song increased.
Around that time the works of tegotomono increased, tegotomono was streamlined further by koyo MINEZAKI or koto MITSUHASHI and the works which emphasized tegoto rather than song increased.
Around that time the works of tegotomono increased, tegotomono was streamlined further by koyo MINEZAKI or koto MITSUHASHI and the works which emphasized tegoto rather than song increased.

sen.j: 峰崎の『吾妻獅子』、『越後獅子』、『残月』、三ツ橋の『松竹梅』、『根曵の松』などが有名曲である。
sen.e: The famous works include "Azuma Jishi" (Lion of Azuma), "Echigojishi," "Zangetsu" (A Morning Moon) by MINEZAKI, "Shochikubai" (pine, bamboo and plum trees), "Nebiki no matsu" (Pine Seedlings) by MITSUHASHI and so on.

Famous works include "Azuma Jishi" (Lion of Azuma), "Echigojishi," "Zangetsu" (A Morning Moon) by MINEZAKI, "Shochikubai" (pine, bamboo and plum trees), "Nebiki no matsu" (Pine Seedlings) by MITSUHASHI and so on.

Famous works include "Azuma Jishi" (Lion of Azuma), "Echigojishi," "Zangetsu" (A Morning Moon) by MINEZAKI, "Shochikubai" (pine, bamboo and plum trees), "Nebiki no matsu" (Pine Seedlings) by MITSUHASHI and so on.

sen.j: さらにこれが京都の音楽家たちに受け継がれ、洗練されて「京流手事物」が生まれ、松浦検校の『宇治巡り』、『四季の眺』、『末の契』など、石川勾当の『八重衣』、『新青柳』など、菊岡検校の『長等の春』、『磯千鳥』、『夕顔』、『茶音頭』など、光崎検校の『桜川』、『七小町』など、数多くの名曲が作られた。
sen.e: Furthermore, these came down to musicians in Kyoto, refined by them and "Kyoto-style tegotomono" (a form of Japanese chamber music) was spawned and the following many famous works were composed: "Uji meguri" (uji tour), "Shiki no Nagame" (Viewing the Four Seasons), "Sue-no-chigiri" and so on by kengyo MATSUURA and "Yaegoromo" (An Eight-Fold Garment), "Shin Aoyagi" (new green willow) and so on by koto ISHIKAWA and "Nagara-no-haru," "Iso Chidori" (beach plover), "Yugao" (Evening Face), "Cha ondo" (Tea Song) and so on by kengyo KIKUOKA and "Sakuragawa" (Sakura river), "Nanakomachi" (Seven Komachi) and so on by kengyo MITSUZAKI.

sen.cmt: 原文で｢｣の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: またこれらの曲に八重崎検校らが箏のパートを付け、あるいは三味線の替手が付けられたり、段合わせや地合わせ、三曲合奏など、さまざまな合奏形態で演奏され、合奏音楽としての発展も著しかった。
sen.e: And kengyo YAEZAKI put the so (or koto) parts to these works or made kaede (accompanying melody) for shamisen and they were played in various ensembles such as danawase (type of ensemble method), jiawase (type of ensemble method), instrumental trio (shamisen (three-stringed Japanese guitar), so (thirteen-stringed Japanese zither), and shakuhachi (bamboo flute)) ensemble and so on and dramatically developed as ensemble music.

And kengyo YAEZAKI put the so (or koto) parts to these works or made kaede (accompanying melody) for shamisen and they were played in various ensembles such as danawase (type of ensemble method), jiawase (type of ensemble method), instrumental trio (shamisen (three-stringed Japanese guitar), so (thirteen-stringed Japanese zither), and shakuhachi (bamboo flute)) ensemble and so on and dramatically developed as ensemble music.

And kengyo YAEZAKI put the so (or koto) parts to these works or made kaede (accompanying melody) for shamisen and they were played in various ensembles such as danawase (type of ensemble method), jiawase (type of ensemble method), instrumental trio (shamisen (three-stringed Japanese guitar), so (thirteen-stringed Japanese zither), and shakuhachi (bamboo flute)) ensemble and so on and dramatically developed as ensemble music.

sen.j: ただしこの時期、大阪でも在原勾当の『さむしろ』、菊山検校の『春の曙』などが作られている。
sen.e: However at that time, "Samushiro" by koto ARIHARA, "Haru no akebono" by kengyo KIKUYAMA and so on were also composed in Osaka.

sen.j: 幕末から明治期にかけても京都では幾山検校の『萩の露』や古川龍斎の『春重ね』など、手事物の地歌曲は引き続き作られた。
sen.e: From the end of Edo period to Meiji period, jiuta by tegotomono such as "Hagi no tsuyu" (Dew on the Bush Clover) by kengyo IKUYAMA or "Harugasane" by Ryusai FURUKAWA and so on were continuously composed in Kyoto.

From the end of the Edo period to Meiji period, jiuta by tegotomono such as "Hagi no tsuyu" (Dew on the Bush Clover) by kengyo IKUYAMA or "Harugasane" by Ryusai FURUKAWA and so on were continuously composed in Kyoto.

From the end of the Edo period to Meiji period, jiuta by tegotomono such as "Hagi no tsuyu" (Dew on the Bush Clover) by kengyo IKUYAMA or "Harugasane" by Ryusai FURUKAWA and so on were continuously composed in Kyoto.

sen.j: いっぽう幕末になると名古屋の吉沢検校の『花の縁』、『夏衣』などをはじめ九州の『尾上の松』、『海女小舟』、広島の『花形見』など、各地でも京流手事物の形式にのっとった曲が作られるようになった。
sen.e: On the other hand, across Japan in the end of Edo period, the works which applied the form of Kyoto-style tegotomono were composed, such as "Hana no enishi," "Natsugoromo" and so on by kengyo YOSHIZAWA in Nagoya, "Onoe no Matsu" (Pine Tree On Mountain) and "Ama obune" in Kyushu and "Hanagatami" in Hiroshima and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, across Japan in the end of Edo period, the works which applied the form of Kyoto-style tegotomono were composed, such as "Hana no enishi," "Natsugoromo" and so on by kengyo YOSHIZAWA in Nagoya, "Onoe no Matsu" (Pine Tree On Mountain) and "Ama obune" in Kyushu and "Hanagatami" in Hiroshima and so on.

On the other hand, across Japan in the end of Edo period, the works which applied the form of Kyoto-style tegotomono were composed, such as "Hana no enishi," "Natsugoromo" and so on by kengyo YOSHIZAWA in Nagoya, "Onoe no Matsu" (Pine Tree On Mountain) and "Ama obune" in Kyushu and "Hanagatami" in Hiroshima and so on.

sen.j: 更に幕末以降、箏曲が地歌から再独立する際にも、『千鳥の曲』をはじめとして、『常世の曲』、『新高砂』、『楓の花』、『御国の誉』、『明治松竹梅』、『時鳥の曲』、『秋の言の葉』など、この形式の箏曲がさかんに作られた。
sen.e: Furthermore after the end of Edo period, when so (or koto) songs became independent from jiuta again, this form of so (or koto) works were actively composed, such as "Chidori no kyoku" (a song for plover), "Tokoyo no kyoku" (a song for eternity), "Shin Takasago song" (literally, "new version of "Takasago"), "Kaede no hana" (a maple flower), "Mikuni no homare" (the glory of the country), "Meiji shochikubai," "Hototogisu no kyoku" (a song for a little cuckoo), "Aki no koto no ha" (Words for autumn) and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore after the end of the Edo period, when so (or koto) songs became independent from jiuta again, this form of so (or koto) works was actively composed, such as "Chidori no kyoku" (a song for plover), "Tokoyo no kyoku" (a song for eternity), "Shin Takasago song" (literally, "new version of "Takasago"), "Kaede no hana" (a maple flower), "Mikuni no homare" (the glory of the country), "Meiji shochikubai," "Hototogisu no kyoku" (a song for a little cuckoo), "Aki no koto no ha" (Words for autumn) and so on.

Furthermore after the end of the Edo period, when so (or koto) songs became independent from jiuta again, this form of so (or koto) works was actively composed, such as "Chidori no kyoku" (a song for plover), "Tokoyo no kyoku" (a song for eternity), "Shin Takasago song" (literally, "new version of "Takasago"), "Kaede no hana" (a maple flower), "Mikuni no homare" (the glory of the country), "Meiji shochikubai," "Hototogisu no kyoku" (a song for a little cuckoo), "Aki no koto no ha" (Words for autumn) and so on.

sen.j: その後も宮城道雄の作品『春の夜』、『比良』、『虫の武蔵野』など新日本音楽でもよく使われ、また現代の作曲家によってもしばしば使われている。
sen.e: After that, the works "Haru no yoru" (a spring night), "Hira," "Mushi no Musashino" (Insects in Musashino) and so on by Michio MIYAGI are used in new Japanese music and often used also by modern composers.

After that, the works "Haru no yoru" (a spring night), "Hira," "Mushi no Musashino" (Insects in Musashino) and so on by Michio MIYAGI were used in new Japanese music and often used also by modern composers.

After that, the works "Haru no yoru" (a spring night), "Hira," "Mushi no Musashino" (Insects in Musashino) and so on by Michio MIYAGI were used in new Japanese music and often used also by modern composers.

sen.j: いっぽう歌本位の山田流箏曲にも、『都の春』、『近江八景』など少数ながら手事物と呼べる曲がある。
sen.e: On the other hand, YAMADA-style so (or koto) songs which were song-oriented have a few tegotomono works such as "Miyako no haru" (The spring in the city) or "The Eight Views of Omi" and so on.
On the other hand, YAMADA-style so (or koto) songs which were song-oriented have a few tegotomono works such as "Miyako no haru" (The spring in the city) or "The Eight Views of Omi" and so on.
On the other hand, YAMADA-style so (or koto) songs which were song-oriented have a few tegotomono works such as "Miyako no haru" (The spring in the city) or "The Eight Views of Omi" and so on.

sen.j: なお長唄でも地歌の影響を受けて、江戸時代末期になると楽式的には地歌の手事物とほぼ同じ構造で、長い「合方」を聴かせる曲がいくつか作られた。
sen.e: Influenced by jiuta, some chokas, which had almost the same structure as the tegoto of jiuta in terms of musical structure and had long "aikata" (partner) songs, were composed in the end of Edo period

Influenced by jiuta, some chokas, which had almost the same structure as the tegoto of jiuta in terms of musical structure and had long "aikata" (partner) songs, were composed in the end of the Edo period

Influenced by jiuta, some chokas, which had almost the same structure as the tegoto of jiuta in terms of musical structure and had long 'aikata' (partner) songs, were composed in the end of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: " "を' 'に変更しました。ピリオドを付けました。

sen.j: 『越後獅子』、『吾妻八景』、『秋色種 (あきのいろくさ)』がその例である。
sen.e: They include, for example, "Echigojishi," "The Eight Views of Azuma" and "Aki no irokusa" (the flowers of autumn).
They include, for example, "Echigojishi," "The Eight Views of Azuma" and "Aki no irokusa" (the flowers of autumn).
They include, for example, "Echigojishi," "The Eight Views of Azuma" and "Aki no irokusa" (the flowers of autumn).

sen.j: 『越後獅子』は地歌の『越後獅子』や『さらし』を取り入れ、『秋色種』もやはり地歌の『虫の音』や箏曲の『みだれ』を取り入れて器楽性を高めている。
sen.e: "Echigojishi" incorporated jiuta such as "Echigojishi" or "Sarashi" (bleached cloth) and "Aki no irokusa" also incorporated jiuta such as "Mushi no ne" (sound of insect) or so (or koto) song called "Midare" (disorder) to enhance the instrument parts.

"Echigojishi" incorporated jiuta such as "Echigojishi" or "Sarashi" (bleached cloth) and "Aki no irokusa" also incorporated jiuta such as "Mushi no ne" (sound of insect) or so (or koto) song called "Midare" (disorder) to enhance the instrument parts.

"Echigojishi" incorporated jiuta such as "Echigojishi" or "Sarashi" (bleached cloth) and "Aki no irokusa" also incorporated jiuta such as "Mushi no ne" (sound of insect) or so (or koto) song called "Midare" (disorder) to enhance the instrument parts.

sen.j: あるいは『京鹿子娘道成寺』の「追回しの合方」のように、既存の曲に後世合方を補作したものもある。
sen.e: Or, like "oimawashi no aikata" (partner as an odd-job man) in "Kyo Kanokomusume Dojoji" (The maiden at Dojo Temple), the existing works were revised and improved to have the aikata's parts later.
sen.cmt: 「後世合方を補作した」の意味がいまひとつ判然としませんでした。
sen.e: Or, like "oimawashi no aikata" (partner as an odd-job man) in "Kyo Kanokomusume Dojoji" (The maiden at Dojo Temple), the existing works were revised and improved to have the aikata's parts later.
Or, like 'oimawashi no aikata' (partner as an odd-job man) in "Kyo Kanokomusume Dojoji" (The maiden at Dojo Temple), the existing works were revised and improved to have the aikata's parts later.
sen.cmt: 原文で｢｣の部分を' 'に変更しました。

sen.j: 合方は地歌で言う手事とほぼ同じであり、「佃」「滝流し」など独自の合方もあり長唄の魅力の一つとなっているが、どちらかといえば描写に徹しており、また大方が劇場音楽であるだけに、はるかに多様な音楽的展開を見せた地歌の手事とは性格を異にする部分もある。
sen.e: Aikatas are almost the same as tegoto in jiuta and the unique aikata such as "Tsukuda" or "Taki nagashi" (Falling down a waterfall) is one enchantment of choka, but they are rather devoted to description and in some points they characteristically differ from the tegoto of jiuta which musically developed far more variously as most of them are for theater music.

Aikatas are almost the same as tegoto in jiuta and the unique aikata such as "Tsukuda" or "Taki nagashi" (Falling down a waterfall) is one enchantment of choka, but they are rather devoted to description and in some points they characteristically differ from the tegoto of jiuta which musically developed far more variously as most of them are for theater music.

Aikatas are almost the same as tegoto in jiuta and the unique aikata such as 'Tsukuda' or 'Taki nagashi' (Falling down a waterfall) is one enchantment of choka, but they are rather devoted to description and in some points they characteristically differ from the tegoto of jiuta which musically developed far more variously as most of them are for theater music.

sen.j: また長唄には地歌の手事物に相当する曲種分類もない。
sen.e: Also, choka have no classification for the genre of song, equivalent to tegotomoto of jiuta.
Also, choka have no classification for the genre of song, equivalent to tegotomoto of jiuta.
Also, choka have no classification for the genre of song, equivalent to tegotomoto of jiuta.

sen.j: このように手事物は人気の高い楽曲形式である。
sen.e: As seen here, tegotomono is a very popular style of compositions.
As seen here, tegotomono is a very popular style of composition.
As seen here, tegotomono is a very popular style of composition.

sen.j: これは、一曲の中で声楽と器楽の両方を楽しむことができ、また曲に変化を持たせやすいからでもあるだろう。
sen.e: This is because audience could enjoy both vocal parts and instrumental parts in one work and the works could be easily changed.
This is because audiences could enjoy both vocal parts and instrumental parts in one work and the works could be easily changed.
